message: After I finish, I spend some time dozing on the sofa.
I check the time on my Coil when I wake up. It's almost dawn already.
Koujaku... is still out.

name: 蒼葉
message: "What the hell is he doing?"
Just then, the front door opens.
I jump up and turn to look.
Koujaku...

name: 紅雀
message: "Were you sleeping? Sorry, didn't mean to wake you."
Koujaku smiles awkwardly, but I don't miss the expression that smile hides.
When he walked through the door, Koujaku had a dark, drained look on his face. An expression like that is drastically out of character for him.
I'm suddenly anxious to know what happened. My plan to give him an earful is forgotten.

name: 紅雀
message: "Sorry for being so late."

name: 紅雀
message: "Aoba?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Oh... Uh, yeah. You sure took your time. What were you doing?"

name: 紅雀
message: "Nothing much."
Nothing much, huh?
But Koujaku doesn't explain any further. He heads straight for the stairs.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Hey, wait a second."
Koujaku stops and turns around.

name: 蒼葉
message: "So, what'd you learn? You know, the whole point of you going with them in the first place?"

name: 紅雀
message: "...Oh, yeah. I was barking up the wrong tree. I got nothing. Sorry."
...What the hell?
I can't stop myself from glaring.

name: 蒼葉
message: "...Listen for a minute."

name: 紅雀
message: "...Sure."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Look man, I don't really care where you were or what you were doing. If you wanna screw around with women, fine."

name: 蒼葉
message: "But I mean, you know what the stakes are, right? There's, like, a time and a place, you know?"
Koujaku frowns apologetically.

name: 紅雀
message: "...Yeah, you're right. Old habits die hard and all. Sorry for worrying you."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Well... whatever. It's not a big deal."
He apologized, so I can't really say anything else. An awkward silence fills the room.
I try to change the subject.

name: 蒼葉
message: "Have you eaten yet?"

name: 紅雀
message: "Yeah, I'm good."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Oh."

name: 紅雀
message: "Man, this villa..."
Koujaku looks around the room.

name: 紅雀
message: "I mean, talk about impressive. You'd never guess from the outside."

name: 蒼葉
message: "Yeah, I was surprised too."

name: 紅雀
message: "Did you check out the second floor yet?"

name: 蒼葉
message: "Bedrooms are up there."

name: 紅雀
message: "Cool. Then I guess it's time to get some shut-eye."
Koujaku hurries upstairs, like he's trying to get away.
But he pauses at the top of the stairs to look at me.

name: 紅雀
message: "I know I'm in no position to lecture here... but you should really get some sleep in a proper bed. Night."
Koujaku disappears down the second floor hall.
For a while, I just stare at the spot where he vanished.
I don't even know how to describe what I'm feeling. What the hell was he doing that whole time?
He avoided my questions. That annoys me, but most of all, it makes me anxious.
Something's going on.
He seemed weirdly distant while we were talking, like his mind wasn't all there.
Maybe things went south with those women?
...If that's all it was, he brought it on himself.
What do I care about them anyway?
I sigh, trying to shake my unease, and head up to the second floor.
I listen carefully before picking a room to avoid walking in on Koujaku.
The room isn't particularly large, but it's clean and well furnished. I flop onto the bed.
...Man, what is up with him?
I stare up at the ceiling as words of frustration cycle through my head. It's been like this ever since Koujaku walked off.
I must be tired, because as my thoughts circle around the issue, I start to get sleepy.
I dozed off on the couch earlier, but nothing beats sleeping in a real bed. I feel as light as a feather.
It's getting hard to keep my eyes open. Slowly, I give in and drift off to sleep.
